Article.Abstract: Recently, we observed that vaccination of BALB/c mice with thyroid peroxidase (TPO)-DNA in a plasmid is highly effective at inducing antibodies that interact with the immunodominant region recognized by human autoantibodies. We have now analyzed the TPO epitopes recognized by memory T cells in these animals. Splenocytes from TPO-DNA (not control DNA)-vaccinated mice responded to TPO protein antigen, as measured by interferon-gamma production. As a group, TPO-immunized mice recognized 35 of 55 overlapping synthetic peptides that encompass the 814-amino acid TPO ectodomain. In individual mice, between five and 10 peptides induced splenocyte responses. Two T cell epitopes were immunodominant, one of which is also recognized by patients with autoimmune thyroid disease. To explore a potential correlation between T and B cell epitopes, we analyzed serum TPO antibody epitopic fingerprints. No relationship was evident. However, the number of T cell epitopes recognized by individual mice was inversely proportional to recognition of an antibody epitopic subdomain. The diversity of TPO T cell epitopes is in striking contrast to the restricted number of TSH receptor (TSHR) peptides (four of 29) recognized by T cells, as is the paucity of antibodies in the same strain of mice vaccinated with TSHR-DNA. In conclusion, our data highlight differences for both antibody and T cell epitopic recognition in TPO- vs. TSHR-DNA-immunized BALB/c mice. These findings provide insight into mechanisms that may be involved in spontaneous immune responses to two major thyroid autoantigens in humans.
Article.ArticleTitle: Naked deoxyribonucleic acid vaccination induces recognition of diverse thyroid peroxidase T cell epitopes.
Article.Affiliations: Cedars-Sinai Medical Center, University of California School of Medicine, Los Angeles, Californoia 90048, USA.
Article.ArticleMeshHeadingsList: Amino Acid Sequence; Animals; Epitopes, T-Lymphocyte; Female; Iodide Peroxidase(chemistry; immunology); Mice; Mice, Inbred BALB C; Molecular Sequence Data; Vaccination; Vaccines, DNA(immunology)

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 3 doses of 100 µg TPO-DNA at 3 week intervals

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Mice were pretreated in the anterior tibialis muscle with cardiotoxin and 5 to 7 days later injected at the same site with TPO-DNA and the vaccination was repeated after 3 and 6 weeks. Mice were euthanized 4 weeks after the third vaccination to obtain spleens.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: The epitope was one of two immunodminant epitopes in BLAB/c mice. Considering the group of eight TPO-DNA vaccinated mice as a whole, the epitope was one of two peptides that induced significantly greater IFN-gamma production than medium alone (P = 0.011).
